dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon
News Content: Nvidia (NVDA)

Chipmaker Nvidia has overtaken Apple (AAPL) once again to become the world's most valuable company, after the company's shares rose in Tuesday's session.

Nvidia now has a market capitalisation of nearly $3.45tn (£2.79tn), compared to Apple's $3.35tn, with shares in the iPhone maker having fallen 3% in the previous session.

Shares in Nvidia climbed more than 2% on Tuesday and were up 2.5% in pre-market trading on Wednesday.

This came after newly reinstated president Donald Trump announced a new $500bn private sector investment to build artificial infrastructure in the US.

Read more: FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks rise as UK borrowing jumps unexpectedly

Initial equity funders for the "Stargate Project" are OpenAI, Oracle (ORCL), SoftBank (9984.T) and MGX, while Nvidia is one of the initial technology partners.

Ben Barringer, technology analyst at Quilter Cheviot, said: "This development is undeniably a boon for the AI sector. Companies involved in supplying the technology and infrastructure for Project Stargate are well-positioned to benefit significantly.

"The move underscores the increasing strategic importance of AI innovation, further solidifying its role as a cornerstone of economic and technological advancement. For investors in the AI space, this announcement highlights a wealth of opportunities as the competition to dominate the sector intensifies."

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Oracle (ORCL)

Shares in Oracle jumped 7% on Tuesday and were up 8% in pre-market trading on Wednesday morning, following Trump's announcement.

The stock was also trending after Trump reportedly said at event on Tuesday that he would be open to Oracle chairman Larry Ellison or Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk purchasing social media app TikTok, as part of a joint venture with the US government.

According to a Bloomberg report, Trump said: "I have the right to make a deal."

"So what I’m thinking about saying to somebody is buy it and give half to the United States of America, half, and we’ll give you the permit, and they’ll have a great partner," he added.

Read more: Pound, gold and oil prices in focus: commodity and currency check, 22 January

In one of his early actions after being sworn in for a second presidential term on Monday, Trump signed an executive order to delay the ban of TikTok in the US.

When asked about Trump's proposal that TikTok-owner, Chinese company ByteDance, hand over half of the platform to a US company, China foreign ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said: "TikTok has operated in the US for years and been very popular with American users."

Story Continues

"It has played a positive role in boosting US employment and consumption. We hope the US will earnestly listen to the voice of reason and provide an open, fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for market entities from all countries."

•USD

(ORCL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Netflix (NFLX)

Shares in Netflix soared 14% in pre-market trading on Wednesday, after the streaming giant reported 18.9 million users in the fourth quarter, with revenue and earnings also beating expectations.

Revenue of $8.83bn for the fourth quarter was up 12.5% year-on-year and diluted earnings per share came in at $2.11 for the final three months of its fiscal year.

The company also announced a $15bn share buyback and raised its full-year revenue outlook to come in between $43.5bn and $44.5bn. That was ahead of its prior range of $43bn to $44bn.

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

Strong subscriber gains came on the back of Netflix ending 2024 with two back-to-back NFL games, a successful "Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson" boxing match, and the return of the highly-popular "Squid Game" series.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "Netflix keeps us hooked with fresh content slates, drawing millions of new viewers while keeping existing customers happy at the same time. This is the last quarter Netflix will report net subscriber growth, and it’s blown expectations out of the water.

"While rivals hike prices and wrestle with losses, Netflix is raking in cash and striking deals like WWE and NFL to strengthen its lineup. Competitors selling their best shows to Netflix only make its library stronger, keeping us watching – and, crucially, paying."

•USD

(NFLX)

Follow  View Quote Details

Adidas (ADS.DE)

In Europe, shares in sportswear brand Adidas surged nearly 7% on Wednesday morning, after the company posted stronger-than-expected preliminary fourth quarter results.

Adidas revenues grew 24% to €5.97bn (£5.05tn) in the fourth quarter, while operating profit reached €57m in the quarter, versus an operating loss of €377m.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

The jump in the shares helped drive the pan-European STOXX 600 (^STOXX) to an all-time high on Wednesday morning.

Deutsche Bank analysts said in a note on Wednesday that they had a "buy" rating on the stock.

"Our buy case on Adidas is built on increasing brand heat, positive earnings momentum and strong EPS growth," they said. "All of this is evidenced again in 4Q."

•USD

(ADS.DE)

Follow  View Quote Details

JD Wetherspoon (JDW.L)

Shares in UK pub operator JD Wetherspoon dipped nearly 2% into the red on Wednesday, after the company's chairman Tim Martin warned of higher costs.

Martin had already warned that costs at Wetherspoons would increase this year by £60m per annum, on the back of increases in the autumn budget to employer national insurance contributions and the national minimum wage.

Read more: Higher-than-expected UK borrowing heaps pressure on Rachel Reeves

"Government-mandated wage increases have a significantly bigger impact on pub and restaurant companies than supermarkets," Martin said.

Derren Nathan, head of equity research at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "There’s no more vociferous campaigner for landlord rights than chairman Tim Martin who has pointed out that volumes of pub’s biggest product line, beer, have collapsed by 52% between 2000 and 2023.

"Average on-trade prices are now at £4.98 per pint and far more sensitive to labour cost increases than supermarket equivalents, where you can pick up 568 ml of refreshment for an average price of £1.20."

In the trading update, JD Wetherspoon reported 5.1% growth in like-for-like sales.

•USD

(JDW.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

Other companies in the news on Wednesday 22 January:

Arm Holdings (ARM)

Apple (AAPL)

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news revolves around Intel's CEO search and strategic challenges, which primarily affect Intel's stock value rather than Apple's. The lack of a clear strategy and uncertainty regarding Intel's future could have a negative impact on technology sector sentiment, potentially affecting Apple indirectly due to its position in the semiconductor supply chain. Analysts speaking negatively about Intel's board and leadership could create broader market concerns in the tech segment. Therefore, while it's common for Apple and Intel's fortunes to be somewhat linked, the specifics of this news do not directly suggest a strong impact on Apple's stock price. As a result, the probabilities are relatively balanced, with a slight tilt towards a potential rise given Apple's continued strong market position and product demand.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news headline suggests Apple is underperforming within the Dow Jones, indicating negative sentiment and potential downward pressure on the stock. However, it also frames this sell-off as a "buying opportunity," implying that the current price may be undervalued. This contradictory aspect makes prediction challenging. Given the negative initial sentiment of underperformance, the probability of an immediate price drop might be slightly higher, but the explicit mention of a "buying opportunity" introduces uncertainty and the potential for a rebound. Further analysis is needed to assess valuation metrics and broader market trends to refine this prediction.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on other companies, with Apple only mentioned in passing as having been overtaken by Nvidia in market capitalization.  While Apple's stock fell 3% the previous session, this article doesn't provide any specific information that directly impacts Apple's future performance. The positive news surrounding AI investments and other tech companies might have an indirect, albeit weak, influence on investor sentiment affecting the broader market (possibly a minor positive effect on Apple). However, the lack of direct Apple-specific news makes it unlikely the price movement will be strongly influenced by this particular article.  Therefore, I'll assign a slightly higher probability to the stock price remaining relatively stable, leaning slightly towards the possibility of a continued, minor downward trend given the previous day's drop and the overall context of Nvidia's rise.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news announces the opening of a new Apple store in Miami, which highlights Apple's commitment to retail expansion, customer experience, and environmental sustainability. The store features innovative design, accessibility options, and special programming, which could enhance brand perception and potentially drive incremental sales. However, the impact of a single store opening on Apple's overall financial performance is likely to be minimal given the company's global scale. The news is positive but not transformative, so it may have a modest positive effect on investor sentiment.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article reports that Samsung Electronics Co. plans to launch an ultrathin version of its Galaxy S25 phone, beating Apple Inc. to a new category. This could potentially impact Apple's market share and competitiveness in the smartphone market. Historically, investors have reacted negatively to news that suggests a company is losing its competitive edge or being outperformed by a competitor. However, Apple's planned release of its own ultrathin iPhone later this year and its strong brand loyalty could mitigate the negative impact. The news is more directly competitive to Apple's future plans rather than its current financials, so the immediate impact might be limited. Considering these factors, there is a slightly higher chance of the stock price falling due to concerns about competitiveness, but the probabilities are not drastically skewed.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline suggests that Samsung is entering the augmented reality glasses market in partnership with Google, which could potentially compete with Apple's products in this category. However, the article also mentions that Apple has been more guarded about its plans, and the competition is not expected to be immediate. Additionally, the article highlights the challenges related to cost and engineering that have made progress slow in this field. Considering these factors, the impact on Apple's stock price may be neutral to slightly negative in the short term, as investors may be concerned about the potential competition. However, it's also possible that Apple's stock price could rise if investors believe that the company is well-positioned to compete in this market or if they expect Apple's products to be superior to those of Samsung and Google.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The financial news indicates that Apple Inc. is the worst-performing stock in the Dow Jones in 2025, suggesting a decline in its stock price. Such underperformance could lead potential investors to view it as a buying opportunity, possibly driving stock prices up. However, the ongoing sell-off might also prompt current shareholders to continue selling, further depressing the stock price. The balance between these two sentiments will determine the direction of the stock price movement.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The provided news focuses primarily on other companies, with Apple's mention being secondary and largely negative (being overtaken by Nvidia in market capitalization and experiencing a 3% drop in the previous session).  While the positive news about AI investment and other tech companies *could* indirectly boost overall market sentiment and thus slightly benefit Apple, this effect would likely be weak and overshadowed by the direct negative news concerning Apple's recent performance and its relative standing compared to Nvidia.  The lack of any specific positive news regarding Apple itself directly contributes to the likelihood of continued downward pressure or at least, a lack of upward momentum in the short term.  Previous predictions show a range of probabilities, with a leaning toward a higher chance of a price fall, which aligns with my assessment.  Considering the overall context, a continuation of the downward trend seems more plausible than a sudden and significant upward swing.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.25,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.75
}
```
